thread.title: LIVE updates: State visit of Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe
thread.title_full: LIVE updates: State visit of Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe

title: LIVE updates: State visit of Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe
text:
LIVE updates: State visit of Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe By PhilstarLIVE (philstar.com)   9:00am Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte, left, is greeted by Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe at the start of their meeting at Abe's official residence in Tokyo, Japan Wednesday, Oct. 26, 2016. President Duterte, speaking in a country that is a staunch U.S. ally and hosts 50,000 American troops, said Wednesday that he wants his country to be fraee of foreign troops, possibly within two years. Issei Kato/Pool Photo via AP 
  Japan Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is set to conduct a two-day state visit to the Philippines starting Thursday. 
This will be Abe’s third official visit to the country. He first visited in 2013 and attended the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation Summit in in 2015. 
Abe’s visit is the first reciprocal one following President Rodrigo Duterte’s visit to Tokyo in October last year. The two countries are known to have one of the closest partnerships in the region, with Japan recently donating patrol ships to the Philippine Coast Guard. 
The prime minister is scheduled to meet Duterte and is also set to meet business groups in Manila and Davao City.
